Metadata: Localization of ecdysteroid receptor immunoreactivit​y in eyestalk and muscle tissue of the American lobster, "Homarus americanus"

In Crustacea, it is possible that ecdysteroid receptor (EcR) expression or activation may vary in muscles through the moult cycle and between muscle groups at a given moult stage acting as a possible mechansism for differential regulation of growth. Reported here as part of a further investigation into the role of ecdysteroids in tissue growth, an immunocytochemi​cal study, using monoclonal antibodies to a "Drosophila melanogaster" EcR, was conducted to identify the presence of EcR in muscle and eyestalk neural tissue from lobsters.
